Key Arguments: The bill infringes on freedom of speech and creates a divide between classes of citizens.
Excessive fines will lead to overly restrictive digital services.
Determining truth is complex and evolving, making the bill's enforcement problematic.
The bill could be anti-competitive, favoring larger digital platforms over smaller ones.
It contradicts the News Media Bargaining Code and could harm minorities.
The bill violates the implied constitutional freedom of political communication.
Notable Quotes: The bill creates a clear divide by establishing two classes of citizens.
Accurately judging what is true or untrue is an impossible task.
The proposed bill is not aligned with the News Media Bargaining Code enacted in 2021.
The power granted to ACMA to give legislative effect to misinformation codes violates the implied constitutional freedom of political communication.
